unnormalised: ## Ditch Netflix, Hit a Film Fest! (Entertainment Alert!)
normalised: Ditch Netflix, Hit a Film Fest! (Entertainment Alert!)

unnormalised: Okay, folks, are you tired of the same old Bollywood masala and Hollywood blockbusters? Do you crave something *more*? Then listen up – it's time to explore the amazing world of film festivals!
normalised: Okay, folks, are you tired of the same old Bollywood masala and Hollywood blockbusters? Do you crave something more? Then listen up – it's time to explore the amazing world of film festivals!

unnormalised: Seriously, film fests are like hidden gems scattered across India, and the world. Think of them as a chance to discover indie filmmakers, documentaries that’ll blow your mind, and stories you'd never see on a regular cinema screen. Forget queuing for hours to watch the latest Karan Johar flick (no shade!), this is about expanding your cinematic horizons.
normalised: Seriously, film fests are like hidden gems scattered across India, and the world. unnormalised: Imagine this: you're in Goa at the International Film Festival of India (IFFI), soaking up the sun by day and watching cutting-edge cinema by night. Or maybe you're in Mumbai, attending the Jio MAMI Mumbai Film Festival and rubbing shoulders with rising stars. From shorts to features, from arthouse dramas to animated wonders, film festivals offer a buffet of cinematic delights.

Or maybe you're in Mumbai, attending the Jio M A M I Mumbai Film Festival and rubbing shoulders with rising stars. From shorts to features, from arthouse dramas to animated wonders, film festivals offer a buffet of cinematic delights.

unnormalised: But here's the real deal: It's not just about watching movies. It's about the atmosphere! It’s the passionate discussions after screenings, the chance to meet the directors and actors, the late-night chai sessions fuelled by caffeine and creative energy. It's about the shared experience of being part of a community that loves cinema just as much as you do.

unnormalised: Plus, let's be honest, film festivals are a great excuse to travel! You could be exploring the backstreets of Kochi during the Kochi-Muziris Biennale and catching screenings on the side. Who needs a vacation when you can have a cultural immersion experience like that?

unnormalised: So, ditch the Netflix binge this weekend and check out your local film festivals. Even smaller cities often host amazing events. Look for festivals celebrating regional cinema - maybe you can find some amazing Malayalam or Bengali gems!
normalised: So, ditch the Netflix binge this weekend and check out your local film festivals. Even smaller cities often host amazing events. Look for festivals celebrating regional cinema - maybe you can find some amazing Malayalam or Bengali gems!

unnormalised: Budget? Don’t worry! Many film festivals have student discounts or offer free screenings. Check their websites for details and start planning your cinematic adventure. A single ticket can cost Rs. 200 or 300. Some even offer workshops for budding filmmakers!
normalised: Budget? Don’t worry! Many film festivals have student discounts or offer free screenings. Check their websites for details and start planning your cinematic adventure. A single ticket can cost rupees two hundred or three hundred. Some even offer workshops for budding filmmakers!

unnormalised: Think of it as an investment in your soul (and your Instagram feed!). Trust me, you won’t regret it. It's way more exciting than another episode of *Bigg Boss*, and you might even discover your next favourite filmmaker! It might be a bit of a trek, some festivals require you to travel like 100km, but the experience is worth it!
